title.narrative: "Envelope 1": Improve Access to Critical Life-Saving, Life-Sustaining Primary and Secondary Health Care to Highly Vulnerable People in NWS.

description.narrative:
The project aims to provide life-saving and life-sustaining coordinated, equitable primary and secondary health services to address the dire need of health services for all age and sex groups boys, girls, women, with attention to people with special needs physical disability, mental disorders, and psychosocial problems, without any sexual discrimination, among IDPs and host communities in two locations in northwest Syria, Ariha in Idleb governorate and Albab in Aleppo governorate. Through this project, SEMA will continue supporting the already existing and functioning two CEmONC facilities (Ariha hospital for children and maternity (HeRAMS code G0705027) located in Ariah subdistrict, in Idleb, and the Maternity hospital (HeRAMS code B0202031) located in Al-Bab subdistrict. Ariha hospital is considered as a first-line referral and front-line facility in an armed conflict area, where it is the only hospital that provides maternity and child health services in Ariha.
The project will provide health services for 83148 beneficiaries (38736 women, 22248 boys, and 22164 girls) (39252 IDPs and 43896 HCs) including all age groups children, adolescences, young adults, and middle-aged adults. The main services to be introduced in Ariha and the maternity hospitals will be as follows: 1. Operate two emergency and comprehensive obstetric and neonatal care units and services. 2. Provide reproductive health care to women and adolescences in the form of antenatal, prenatal, natal, postnatal care, family planning services, and STIs management. 3. Provide normal, assisted deliveries and C-section deliveries. 4. Provide gynecologic, pediatric, inpatient, and outpatient services for women and children. 5. Provide safe abortion and post-abortion care, including emergency treatment of abortion complications. 6. Provide life-saving services to GBV survivors, services including clinical management of rape, taking into consideration ensuring privacy, confidentiality, and preservation of information 7. Support the provision of essential medicines, medical supplies, and equipment to direct beneﬁciaries and the provision of reproductive health and safe delivery kits. 8. Implement capacity building program including (CMR, RH protocols, ANCampPNC, STIs management) to service providers.
SEMA will coordinate with the referral network to refer the cases that need further investigations and services. SEMA will ensure privacy, equity, and easy access to the services as there will be a Women Waiting area within the facilities, and having available female staff to deal with women and children smoothly. SEMA will apply the Essential health package to effectively and efficiently deliver comprehensive quality health services that are equitable, accessible, and sustainable. To track the progress of the activities and ensure it is in line with the plan, SEMA will provide quantitative and qualitative reports that include disaggregated information about cases/age, sex, gender, and disability. including reporting to DHIS program.
